fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49120].
  {panel}

Default event types don't have a What field (and have non-compulsory Summary further down instead), whereas custom events do have the compulsory What field (towards the top and no Summary).

It's very confusing for users to have to create/edit calendar entries differently depending on the Event Type. We don't differentiate Event Types as custom or default internally - we just want the calendar to work the same way for everyone/everything.

The What/Summary fields show as the “description” in the calendar view so they are helpful.

We would just prefer not to have them as different fields for each event type - and not be compulsory.
fields.summary: Change "description" fields on Custom and Default Event Types so that they are the same.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49118].
  {panel}

ical Calendar parsing is slow.

I saw that you are using ical4j version 1.0-rc3-atlassian-8.

I have an example ics file with ca. 300 VEVENTs. Parsing it takes ca. 7s on my laptop.
Parsing it with any ical4j version >= 1.0 takes 450-600ms.

I suggest you look at merging back (at least some of) the improvements in the ical4j mainline.

I realise your customisations may make that difficult. Please at least look at integrating this straightfoward 3-line change that avoids useless expensive Calendar creation: https://github.com/ical4j/ical4j/commit/b4215c3d3559afbfc1530e4121708e8c61f0d18e

In my tests that alone cut 2/3 off the parsing time of your ical4j version.
fields.summary: ical4j parsing perfomance

Google Calendar has this feature.
I want to schedule a meeting and find a time where everybody is free. So I select all the people I want to attend and the calendar shows me when everybody's free.

For meetings, where lots of people with lots of other stuff on their schedules come together - which is just about every meeting as far as I am concerned - we are really missing this.

At the moment, I would have to export a bunch of calendars, overlay them and then look for free spaces. So we don't do that and just use a HUGE Doodle or talk 10 minutes as a group about the scheduling instead, both of which is annoying.

Of course it get a bit complicated regarding calendars I am not allowed to view. I think it would be best if there were an on/off switch for taking events not visible to the current user (who is creating the new event) into account.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49100].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Users who attempt to open a Confluence Page displaying multiple Calendar Macros with many Calendars experience Local Browser crashes which indicate "high memory usage detected"

h3. Environment
* Confluence 6.0.0-OD-2015.50.1-0003 with Team Calendars 5.3.8-D20151021T015515  
* Browsers:
** Firefox 42
** Chrome 46

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Confluence Page and embed multiple (3) a Calendar Macros which contain multiple Calendars (30+) (Calendars range from 1-10+ Event Types)

h3. Expected Results
Page loads and does not consume 2+ GB of Local Resources for displaying this page in the browser

h3. Actual Results
Browser throws an error indicating "high memory usage detected 2GB"
Server utilization is low and Confluence logs do not indicate an issue
 
h3. Notes
With 3 Calendar Macros with ~30 Calendars each, Browser Memory utilization ranges 1.5 GB - 3 GB in both Firefox and Chrome
Removing 2 of the 3 Macros does improve memory utilization to about 400 MB - 1 GB when loaded
Systems with greater resources may not experience this issue as a lower resourced machine

h3.Workaround
Reduce the number of Calendar Macros, Calendars, and Event Types displayed
fields.summary: Reduce Local Browser Memory Usage When Loading Large Calendars in Confluence

h1. Problem
In default configuration, you can subscribe or watch a calendar, which affects that you receive email notifications every time anyone creates or updates calendar events in these calendars. 
This floods the inbox of our team members and important notifications are potentially ignored. 

h1. Idea
It would be helpful if you could globally (or personally) configure the calendar notifications to receive only email notifications if you are mentioned in or invited to an event.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49079].
  {panel}

Since Team Calendars 1.0, Calendars have lived outside spaces. What this has meant that they have a different permission and notification model to spaces. 

We've learnt over the last few years that for most calendars, they really belong to a space. 

We should consider changing Team Calendars so that they live in spaces. Some things to think about:

* How do we migrate existing calendars?
** You can link a calendar to a space today - we could use this
** What if the calendar has different permissions to space permissions?
* What is the experience for creating a new calendar? 
* Should Calendars should be part of space export / import

It could look something like this: 
http://cl.ly/image/3F3m2g0B0Z0x
fields.summary: Team Calendars should live in Spaces

Users would like to insert a calendar macro in Confluence which dynamically changes to the current user's personal calendar. If you attempt to insert the link ~/calendar/mycalendar.action, it will only display as a link to the calendar, but not display the calendar macro itself.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49073].
  {panel}

I'd like to request the ability to integrate/embed my Outlook Calendar with Team Calendar.

The Scenario is as follows:
- Our company (~1600 employees) uses Outlook/Exchange Calendar for personal availability, meeting and vacation scheduling.
- Thus Team Calendar will always be on at least second position to fill with calendar information. So at your team/project you need to put your vacation information for example on two systems.
- So managing personal Calendar information in only one system (the personal one in outlook) would be nice. --> Team calendar should only aggregate calendar information.

To integrate Outlook I see following possibilities:
- It gets an adapter to fetch MS-Exchange Calendar Information (providing server and authentification information)
- there is a plugin/modus via export/import
- There is a Module/Plugin for Outlook to bind it into Outlook Client and set up write/read permissions to the Team Calendar... :)
- maybe other more ideas.
fields.summary: Outlook Integration

  {panel}

Now event items have two different states, thanks to the filter condition(s):
- True: The event item matches the event filter condition(s).
- False: The event item didn't matches the event filter condition(s).

I think it would be nice to have multiple/custom event states and for each event state you got a specific filter condition, for example:
- Visible, filter: (JQL) project=Team AND status=Open
- Half-visible, filter: (JQL) project=Team AND status=Review
- Invisible, filter: (JQL) project=Team AND status=Closed

h3. Removing a calendar from the users view throws an error.

Steps to Reproduce
 # Subscribe to a calendar
 # Click on the calendar menu > Remove
 # Select "Remove calendar..."

h3. Expected Results
h3. The calendar is removed from your calendar view.
h3. Actual Results

The following error is displayed:

 

*Error(s) occurred.*

Rollback to Team Calendars 5.3.11

 # Download Team Calendars [5.3.11|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/download/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.extra.team-calendars/version/2260]
 # Install Team Calendars 5.3.11 via [file upload|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/UPM/Installing+add-ons#Installingadd-ons-Installingbyfileupload]

fields.description:
In the team calendar list view, the list doesn't empty properly when hiding or deleting all events from the view.
h3. Steps to reproduce:

_Scenario A:_
 * Create two calendars _Cal A and Cal B._
 * Add an event for each calendar on today's date
 * Go to the Calendar [List] Tab and view today's date - see that there are 2 events
 * Disable _Cal A_ and then _Cal B_ - you will see that the events from Cal A hide correctly but Cal B's events remain even though it's hidden. 

_Scenario B:_
 * Go to listview on an empty page
 * Create two events on today's date and view them in listview.
 * Select each event in listview and delete it. 
 * The first event you delete will disappear but the second one doesn't.
 * Both events should disappear from listview when deleted in that view, but doesn't if it's the last event on the page
 * When you refresh the page the event will be gone.

h3. Expected Behaviour:

Events that are deleted or hidden will disappear from the view.
h3. Actual Behaviour:

The last remaining event / events on the list view page won't disappear from view when they are hidden or deleted.
fields.summary: In calendar the list view events keep showing after hiding the only visible calendar or deleting all events from the view.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Team Calendar allows users to specify JIRA filters when they create an event of 'JIRA Issue Dates' event type with 'Saved filter'. However, JIRA filters don't update as quickly as other JIRA items in Team Calendar even though JIRA's version is 6.4 or later (those versions of Confluence update other JIRA items quickly).

h3. Steps to Reproduce

h5. Reproduction-1 (the newly created JIRA filter is not there)
# Install these:
-- JIRA Core 7.0.0
-- Confluence 5.9.1
-- Team Calendar 5.3.9
# Create an Application Link between JIRA and Confluence
# Create a new Calendar
# Create a new JIRA filter
# Try to create an event as follows:
## Click 'Add Event'
## Select 'JIRA Issue Dates' event type
## Select 'Saved Filter'
## You will find the created JIRA filter is not there

h5. Reproduction-2 (the recently deleted JIRA filter is still there)
# Install these:
-- JIRA Core 7.0.0
-- Confluence 5.9.1
-- Team Calendar 5.3.9
# Create a new JIRA filter
# Create an Application Link between JIRA and Confluence
# Create a new Calendar
# Delete the created JIRA filter
# Try to create an event as follows:
## Click 'Add Event'
## Select 'JIRA Issue Dates' event type
## Select 'Saved Filter'
## You will find the deleted JIRA filter is still there

h3. Expected Results
- The newly created JIRA filter will be shown
- The recently deleted JIRA filter will be hidden

h3. Actual Results
- The created JIRA filter will not be shown as quickly as other JIRA items in Team Calendar
- The created JIRA filter will not be hidden as quickly as other JIRA items in Team Calendar

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log file, when you proceed the 'Reproduction-2' above:
{noformat}
2015-12-16 11:56:01,707 ERROR [http-bio-8090-exec-3] [extra.calendar3.rest.JiraCalendarResource] getResponseError Unable to get projects of linked JIRA application 3054a7b4-5d84-3728-b5b6-55527b88a2dc
 -- referer: http://mycompany.com:8090/confluence/calendar/mycalendar.action | url: /confluence/rest/calendar-services/1.0/jira/3054a7b4-5d84-3728-b5b6-55527b88a2dc/date-fields/filter/10003.json | userName: myusername
com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.JiraAccessor$JiraResponseException: The response from filter=10003 didn't make sense
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
The {{maxEntriesLocalHeap}} and {{timeToLiveSeconds}} settings as follows in {{<confluence-home>/shared-home/config/cache-settings-overrides.properties}} file as a workaround did not work, though it seems to have worked previously (See the 'Better Workaround' section in TEAMCAL-1198):
{noformat}
cache.maxEntriesLocalHeap.com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.DefaultJiraAccessor\:cache-jira-query-option=1
cache.timeToLiveSeconds.com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.DefaultJiraAccessor\:cache-jira-query-option=1
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
Manually flush Confluence caches by going to Confluence Admin > Cache Statistics and click 'Flush' at {{com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.DefaultJiraAccessor:cache-jira-query-option}}

There is an undocumented REST API available to flush the cache:
- End point: /rest/cacheManagement/1.0/cacheEntries
- Method: DELETE
- Request Body: 'cacheName=com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.DefaultJiraAccessor%3Acache-jira-query-option'
- Example CURL command:
{code}
$ curl -u <UserID>:<Password> -X DELETE 'http://<Confluence-BaseURL>/rest/cacheManagement/1.0/cacheEntries' -d 'cacheName=com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.DefaultJiraAccessor%3Acache-jira-query-option'
{code}
fields.summary: JIRA filters don't update as quickly as other JIRA items in Team Calendar

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you add a JIRA Sprint Event in Team Calendar, the event is showing as All Day event in *Team Calendar* Week View.
However it is not showing as All Day event in *Apple Calendar App* Week View


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a sprint event with Sprint Duration 30/Dec/16 9:40 PM•09/Jan/17 9:40 PM PM in JIRA
# Create a new event in Confluence's Team Calendar, and add the sprint created above
# Switch to Week View. Team Calendar is showing the event as an "All Day" event:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Go to Apple Calendar App and subscribe to this calendar
# Go to Week View

h3. Expected Results
Event is displayed as "All Day" event, just like it's being displayed in Team Calendar

h3. Actual Results
The event is being displayed as an "hourly" event and sometimes block the view of other events:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JIRA Sprint Event is not being displayed as All Day Event in Apple Calendar App Week View

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49013].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce :
# Login to Confluence as administrator
# Install Team Calendar
# Click on Add Calendar
# Add a new event to the newly created calendar
# Fill in the mandatory fields and choose Daily from the Repeat drop down menu
# Click Ok to confirm adding the event

# Login to Confluence as a regular user
# Add the newly created calendar by the administrator previously
# Edit one of the recurring events and change the event name
# Now delete the event that have been edited
# You will be prompted with the following message :
!deleteEvent.jpg|thumbnail!
# Once deleted, all recurring events will be deleted as well.

Current behavior : No option to only delete 1 event, instead it will delete all events.
Expected behavior : The following dialog should appear to give you 3 options 
!deleteOptions.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: deleting recurring events deletes everything without giving any options

fields.description:
h3. Description
When users added a JIRA sprint event that contains task from multiple projects and subscribe using ICalendar. It will display the first project key that added into the board rather than the project key that selected.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create an application link between Confluence and JIRA
# Create a JIRA Agile project name ABC
# Create some task in Project ABC
# Create a JIRA Agile project name ASD
# Create some task in project ASD
# Create a scrum board that includes project ABC and ASD. (add project ABC first)
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Create a sprint with sprint name "ABC Sprint 1" and add task from project ABC and project ASD
# Locate to Confluence
# Create a calendar
# Add a JIRA Sprint Event type
# In the project field, select project ASD and add the event
# In Confluence, the event will not show the project key before the sprint name (ABC Sprint 1)
# Use ICalendar to subscribe the calendar
# You will notice the project key (ABC) are display before the sprint name (ABC Sprint1)
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

Expected Result
The project key should show ASD as user selected the project ASD

Actual Result
The project key ABC is displayed
fields.summary: Event Display Wrong Project key in ICalendar

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users who are restricted from a calendar are able to see the title when the calendar is embedded in a page where the user have viewing permissions.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

- there is a group for internal (company) Confluence users called *blue-confluence-users*
- there is another group for all external users called *red-confluence-users*
- there is a user *testuser* who is member of the group  *red-confluence-users*
- there is a space called Test 
-* to which members of group *blue-confluence-users* have write access 
-* user testuser has read access.
- the calendar _Project Calendar_ has a viewing restriction to the group *blue-confluence-users* so that no external user can see it
- the is a calendar macro on the space home page that includes the Project calendar and another team calendar
- (/) user _testuser_ cannot find the calendar _Project Calendar_ via 'Calendars' menu

h3. Expected Results

- user testuser cannot see the title of the Project Calendar on the page where it is embedded

h3. Actual Results

- user testuser *can* see the title of the Project Calendar, but not any events.
fields.summary: Team Calendar macro does not hide title of calendar from users restricted from seeing the calendar

Any advise?

Best - Peter

fields.description:
h2. Summary

- While editing a page that is using a Page Layout (any) and you have a Team Calendar on the sectioned part (any), by clicking in any other sectioned part it will duplicate when you change it's view type.

h2. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a Page Layout to a page.
# Add a Team Calendar to a sectioned part.
# Click on the any other sectioned part.
# Click on the Team Calendar you just added and change the view type (Month, Week, List, Timeline).

h2. Expected Results
- Team Calendar will change it's *view type*.

h2. Actual Results
- Team Calendar will not change it's *view type* and will duplicate the calendar with the new view type in the other sectioned part you last clicked.

h2. Workaround
- While changing the *view type* of a calendar, don't click and leave the cursor anywhere else that is not in the *sectioned part* that contains the Team Calendar you are editing and it will change normally.
- Issue happens only in *Firefox*. Use another browser.
fields.summary: Changing the type of a TeamCalendar add a new view of this calendar duplicating it
Single user (or more?) don't get notification from a single calendar anymore.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49000].
  {panel}

When I create a calendar event, I get the option to set a reminder.

When I try to set a reminder, I see a lot of options and information. I don't want to go through all that right now so I cancel out of it, but it cancels my whole new event, losing all my changes.

It feels heavy and complex, and too different to how reminders are set in every calendar app I've seen. 

But most importantly, it unexpectedly loses my content without warning.
fields.summary: When creating a new calendar event, setting a reminder then cancelling loses your event

h3. Summary
Drag and drop of JIRA Issue Dates to another date to update its date is not working.

# Ensure that user has Edit and Schedule Issue Permission
